section.title: Introduction
section.p: The story tracker template shows how Mingle can be used to track development progress using just a single card type and a few properties. This template may be particularly useful for users new to Mingle or those who just need a simple structure to begin tracking stories.

bullets.title: There are:
bullets.item: a couple of simple charts and tables on the project overview page that have been created to illustrate the status of the project

section.title: Card and property set-up
section.p: There is one card type in the project: "Story"
There are 3 card properties in use in this project.

section.title: Transitions
section.p: All the transitions in this template are used to help impose a simple workflow allowing users to move stories between statuses. For example, using the "Move Story to Open" transition will set the story to the status "Open" and request the user add an estimate to the story. This will help ensure that all open and closed stories have an estimate.

section.title: Charts and tables
section.p: There is one chart and one table on the project overview page that shows the current status of the project. The "Stories remaining" table shows all the stories that have not been completed. The pie chart shows how many of the MUST stories have been completed.

section.title: Favorites and tabs
section.p:
There are 2 saved Favorites and tabs in the project. Both are currently been used a tabs.
Story Wall - shows the current status of stories in the project.
Story Backlog - shows all the stories that still have to be completed.
